intro: Calamus aruensis, commonly known as the Aru calamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Indonesian island of Aru and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Calamus aruensis is often found in wetland or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
